title: 108_hr4961
content: The "Medicaid Act of 2004" extends Medicaid state fiscal relief. The "Medicaid Act of 2004" extends Medicaid state fiscal relief by amending the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003 to freeze Medicaid FMAP for certain states. The Medicaid Act of 2004 extends Medicaid state fiscal relief by freezing Medicaid FMAP for certain states for fiscal year 2005 if it is lower than the FMAP for fiscal year 2004. Additionally, there is a temporary increase in Medicaid FMAP for all states for specific calendar quarters in fiscal years 2003 and 2004. The Medicaid Act of 2004 extends Medicaid state fiscal relief by freezing FMAP for certain states for fiscal year 2005 if lower than 2004. There is a temporary increase in FMAP for all states for specific calendar quarters in fiscal years 2003 and 2004. The Medicaid Act of 2004 extends Medicaid state fiscal relief by freezing FMAP for certain states for fiscal year 2005 if lower than 2004. In specific calendar quarters of fiscal years 2003 and 2004, there is a temporary increase in cap on Medicaid payments to territories. The Social Security Act will increase amounts by 5.90% for certain quarters in fiscal year 2004 and 2005 for Puerto Rico, the Virgin Islands, Guam, the Northern Mariana Islands, and American Samoa. Conforming amendments are made to the Jobs and Growth Act. Conforming amendments are made to the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003, adjusting paragraphs and calendar quarters for fiscal years 2004 and 2005. In 2004 and fiscal year 2005, amendments were made to the Jobs and Growth Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2003, changing dates from October 1, 2004 to January 1, 2005.
